name: Aston Kaanapali Shores

reviews.text: The beach location of this hotel was excelent, we had to walk no more that 100 feet to be on the beach. Still not happy about having to pay for parking, you'd think as a guest of the hotel they would let you park there for free. Also very unhappy with the fact that thier idea of tempature control is that they control it. No thermostat in the room. The bell boy made a big deal of pointing out where is should be and faked shock at the wires sticking out of the wall and even "called" maintanance to report it. We called agian the next day to ask about it and they did not seemed surprised at all that there was no control in the room, but said they would be right up to fix it, never showed up. The room was cool, but at night, it got chilly, would of been nice to have the option of turning it on and off as we pleased. The hotel staff overall was friendly. The room was clean although dated, and the grounds are beautiful. Would stay again if only for the location.
reviews.title: Loved the beach location

likes.disliked: — not being able to control the air conditioning

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel in May with my family of 5 in a 2 bedroom condo. The weather was excellent and the island unbelievable! The hotel's lobby and grounds were excellent and well done. The room though was very dated, with the kitchen appliances from the 70's. The room smelled old, especially with the a/c on. Luckily we spent most of our time doing things on the island and not in our room. The hotel cost though, was low. If you need a place to stay and are not going to spend time in your room, then this may be ok for you. If your looking for a resort type vacation, this is not it. BTW, the pool was always crowded with kids and there were many big rocks in the water. We had to go to the next hotel to go swimming in the ocean.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for
Great first experience in Maui
reviews.text: We booked our trip to Maui, and selected RQKS by watching the reviews here. We took into account both the good and bad reviews. It was our first trip to Hawaii, and our 25th anniversary.We opted to save $ on our hotel(condo) to have more for excursions. We made the right decision. We were pleasantly surprised by the beauty of the front entrance and the tropical lushness of the grounds. Room 931 had a beautiful ocean view, looked down on the waterfall area and was very nice. King bed, central air. updated kitchen. Large sofa, adequate lanai where we enjoyed the mornings with coffee and the local paper. We liked having a washer/dryer in the room. The WiFi worked a bit slow, but we weren't there to stay in our rooms anyway. There was a note of apology in the bathroom for a small tile repair that had a temporary patch, no big deal. The Expedia presentation was very helpful! The restaurant adequate. We had been informed by a friend to stop at Safeway to get food, so that worked out well, and went to Starmart otherwise. The front desk staff were helpful but not that friendly. We will come here again, as we had such a good experience here!

*If you get a chance, take the Trilogy snorkeling cruise to Lanai, they are a first-class crew all the way. All day with snacks, dolphin sitings,lunch, friendly and helpful crew, BBQ dinner, snorkeling, tour of the island, came back at sunset..Great day!
reviews.title: I will never book this place again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place has the worst service ever.
reviews.title: Plain and Simple
Great Family Resort
reviews.text: We just returned from spending 6 days at the Kaanapli Shores after spending 5 days on Waikiki Beach. Next time we will travel to Maui only. Very relaxing and laid back. The resort is a very accomodating resort for a family. If you have pre-teen to teenage children, request a ground floor that faces the garden, so that you can come and go from your patio. We had the perfect room (#105) on the ground floor across from the pool, restaurant and a few steps from the beach! What a view. We just went in and our from our patio. Our kitchen and bath had not been updated yet, but the rest of the furnishings and decorations were very nice. The grocery store across the street was convenient and pretty reasonable. You just have to accept that nothing is going to cost what you pay at home. For the reasonable rates this was a great choice. We would definitly stay there again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This condo complex/resort was rated by Hotwire as a 4 star. Our opinion is that it is actually 3 to 31/2 stars. It wasn't a bad hotel, just dated. Our particular condo was very clean and neat, updated linens on the bed, but the appliances and the overall kitchen was very old and dated. The latches were broken on most appliances, drawers wouldn't open due to poor design, etc.
reviews.title: enjoyed with some reservation

reviews.text: If you can live with that, it's not bad. The furnishings were early '80s bamboo design, really ugly in my opinion.
reviews.title: beware of what your getting
Don't stay in the front building!
reviews.text: We only stayed three nights at this place and moved to our time share at the Marriott. So for us it wasn't too bad.

The location, however, was great. It was away from all the congestion of the Whaler Village area with better beaches than in front of the Marriott. Not much to eat around there, but the hotel restaurant wasn't too bad for dinner.
reviews.title: Love it

reviews.text: Pretty nice place to stay. No windows that opened in the bedroom making it very claustrophobic in the the bedroom. Kitchen nice to have since could save money on food by cooking meals. Housekeepers did not wash dishes or empty dishwasher. Room smelled very moldy. It was an ok place to stay for the price, did not spend much time in the room. Hotel amenities were fair. Pool was not elaborate or in any way special. Shoreline was nice with quite a drop off into the ocean. Pool side restaurant was very expensive and did not serve anything spectacular or interesting. Had to search for coffee in the morning, and it was not complimentary. Went next door to adjacent resort to buy coffee. Return trip to Maui, would not stay again.
reviews.title: Pretty Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first trip to the Hawaiian islands and we had a great time at Kaanapalli Shores. We booked a one bedroom standard view for 8 nights. There was a promotion for a free upgrade based on view only... however when we got their there wasn't any rooms available for the upgrade. We were fine with the view as we could still see the ocean. Since it was our first trip, we were never in our room anyways so it didn't matter. The staff was very friendly and said we could check back for that upgrade anytime... we never did. Our room was very nice and clean, the room was cleaned daily. The restaurant on site was very good and we ate there 3 times... each time the food was very good. The beach was perfect and you could walk for miles in any direction. The only issue was their were some rocks right in front of the resort with limited swimming and boogie boarding, etc. Although a lot of people were swimming so it isn't a big deal. The only other complaint is that the pool was pretty basic... but I guess that is what you pay for.... the bigger resorts have large/elaborate pools and slides, etc. When we visit Maui again we will probably stay elsewhere, however it was worth the price.
reviews.title: Good Resort

likes.disliked: — Rocky ocean and location from Lahaina.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I won't ever stay here again. They fool you with the nice lobby, but the rooms are old and smelly. There really isn't too much to do at the hotel itself. It has one resturant which has mediocre food and service.
reviews.title: Not a 4 star --- Will not stay here again
Great Resort
reviews.text: We had a group of 8 adults and 2 children in the nicest condos in the resort - 901 and 902. This is the Penthouse floor on the ocean and they are very modern and very nice. The wrap-around lanai's had breathtaking views of the pacific, the islands of lanai and Molokai. The views from both condos will be in my mind forever. Absolutely beautiful.

reviews.title: Beware of the Roaches
reviews.text: The condo's had very comfortable furniture and beds. The kitchens were a bit dated, however, we didn't cook much either. The facilities at the resort were great - 2 pools, jacuzzi's, very affordable restaurant (kids eat free), and of course it's located directly on the beach. The drawbacks are it is located about 2.5 - 3 miles north of the actual Kaanapali beach, but it's not nearly as crowded as Kaanapali beach either. Also, don't expect the Westin or Ritz as far as pools and restaurants go - this is a nice, affordable family resort that caters to just that - families.

This hotel is the greatest that I have seen on Maui. The service is friendly and very accomodating and the room had spectacular views. I had an ocean view room and was very pleased with the view and the room was more like an apartment than a hotel room. The couch was huge and the kitchen had all I needed if I wished to make my meals there. I did use the restaurant often and the service and the food were top notch! The sunset view from the table was breathtaking! This hotel is worth every penny paid for it, and I will try to make this an annual event.
reviews.title: Kaanapali Shores is the best on Maui

likes.disliked: — That I could not stay longer!

reviews.text: Could not be more happier! After a booking mistake on our part, the staff immediately assisted us in correcting. The room was fantastic... clean, roomy, updated furniture & overall theme. The hotel was spectacular - from the open lobby with fountains, to the nearby multiple pools, restaurant, etc. Everything you could want for a perfect stay and more. Highly recommend and would return in a heartbeat!
reviews.title: Maui at its Best

likes.liked: — Accomodations so that you did not have to leave the grounds for a goo dtime

reviews.title: Had to change rooms--would most likely not stay again
reviews.text: A+ hotel & accomodations

From my perspective, I'm not quite sure Kaanapali Shores earns the title "Resort". Our first condo (a 2 BR/2BA Ocean View) had a very poor heating / cooling system and an old stained carpet. It also had a loft --unfortunately the loft was unusable due to the poor cooling system--it was too hot. The circulation in the condo was terrible--we all had a bad first nights sleep. After 1 night we requested to be moved. The manager was very nice and let us look at several other condos. Two of the three that we looked at were similar to what we had but one condo had new carpeting, an upgraded kitchen and a new heating/ cooling unit. We moved to that condo. Our experience after that was good. The beach is great for snorkeling, the pools are nice, the resort area is safe and and the Expedia desk was great. Would we stay there again? Probably not. The second bedroom has twin beds so with a family of five one kid had to sleep on the pullout. Other condos we have stayed at have queens in the second bedroom--something we would make sure we got next time (according to the front desk they don't have this setup at Kaanapali Shores). Unless you get an upgraded room (of which there are few) prepare to go back to the 1970s.
reviews.title: Great for a Family!

reviews.text: We just returned from a week at the Kaanapali Shores on Maui. I have to say that it turned out to be a great place to stay with young children. We had booked a 2 bedroom oceanview condo and when we arrived we were asked if we wanted to upgrade to an oceanfront condo with a wrap around deck (room 901) to be exact for $120 a night on top of the charge that we had already paid through our travel agent. The view was amazing. Each time an employee heard what room we were in they commented that it was the best room in the house. We fell asleep each night to the waves on the beach below and enjoyed sitting out on our balcony looking at the view. The condo was very spacious for 6 people. We were a little taken aback that the 2nd bedroom only had 2 twin beds. As a result, my husband and I slept on the sofa bed. I do agree with other reviews that the appliances in the kitchen need upgrading as does much of the carpet in the common areas. Overall I would say that the resort could use a freshening up, but like my husband said we did not have to worry that the kids were going to damage anything. Housekeeping was very accommodating and came at the time when we asked them to. I thought the beach out in front was great. Many chairs and lots of room. Having 2 pools was great-one was more of a kids pool which was great with little ones. The staff was very helpful with my mother who is disabled. They always got her a taller lounge chair at the pool and even had an extender for the toilet as it sits very low. I do have to say that their "Kids Eat Free" program is a little bit of a hoax. It only applies at lunch time, and is contingent on an adult meal being purchased for each kids meal. There also was a special "Kids Eat Free" menu that limited the choices. I will say that the restaurant is good and we ate there several times. All in all we had a great time and would stay here again!
reviews.title: Decent value and beautiful grounds, but no A/C or internet

likes.disliked: — No A/C, no internet, aging facilites, non-functioning lights in room

description: Located beachfront on Kaanapali Beach, this magnificent condominium resort combines spacious, well-appointed suites with hotel-caliber services. Amenities include complete kitchens, WiFi, activity desk and a year-round kids program, Camp Kaanapali. This self-contained property also boasts a beachfront restaurant and bar, fitness center and spa featuring an indoor/outdoor massage service.
